weeks.title: Week 1: Foundation, Resume & LinkedIn Setup
weeks.description: Establish strong foundation documents + Start coding fundamentals
goals: Optimize resume with quantified impact statements
Build compelling LinkedIn profile with 30+ network connections
Develop 8-10 STAR stories covering all dimensions
Start with array and string fundamentals (20 problems)

days.title: Resume Audit & Optimization
days.description: Review current resume against top FAANG examples, add quantified metrics

tasks.title: Review Resume Against FAANG Examples
tasks.description: Study top resumes from Blind, Levels.fyi, GitHub

tasks.title: Rewrite Bullet Points with Metrics
tasks.description: Add quantified achievements: % improvement, revenue impact, scale metrics
tasks.notes: Target 5-7 bullets. Use: Reduced, Optimized, Architected, Led, Scaled

tasks.title: Update Projects Section
tasks.description: Add 2-3 flagship projects with GitHub links and technical depth
tasks.notes: Include: tech stack, impact, link to GitHub

days.title: LinkedIn Deep Dive
days.description: Build professional LinkedIn presence and initial network

tasks.title: Setup LinkedIn Profile
tasks.description: Profile picture, headline, summary, current role, skills
tasks.notes: Headline format: Software Engineer | {Languages} | Seeking {Roles} in {Locations}

tasks.title: Write Compelling Summary
tasks.description: 150-200 word summary highlighting technical depth and career goals

tasks.title: Add Skills & Endorsements
tasks.description: List all relevant skills (Python, Java, AWS, Docker, etc.)

tasks.title: Connect with 30 Engineers at Target Companies
tasks.description: Find and send personalized connection requests
tasks.notes: Mention something specific about their work in message

days.title: Arrays Deep Dive + STAR Stories Brainstorm
days.description: Start coding problems + identify career stories

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #1 (Two Sum)
tasks.description: Hash map approach

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #88 (Merge Sorted Array)
tasks.description: Two pointers approach
tasks.keyTakeaway: Three pointers from end (avoid extra space)

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #167 (Two Sum II)
tasks.description: Two pointers on sorted array

tasks.title: Brainstorm STAR Stories
tasks.description: List 20 achievements, pick top 10, categorize
tasks.notes: Categories: Leadership, Technical Excellence, Conflict, Failure, Impact

days.title: Arrays & Strings + STAR Story Development
days.description: Continue coding + develop first STAR stories

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #121 (Best Time to Buy Stock)
tasks.description: Tracking min price

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #238 (Product of Array Except Self)
tasks.description: Prefix and suffix products

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #49 (Group Anagrams)
tasks.description: Hash map with sorting

tasks.title: Write First STAR Story (Leadership)
tasks.description: Situation, Task, Action, Result format - 1.5-2 min delivery
tasks.notes: Action should be 3-4 sentences on what YOU did

days.title: Strings & Hashing + More STAR Stories
days.description: More coding problems + develop additional stories

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #125 (Valid Palindrome)
tasks.description: Two pointers with filtering

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #76 (Minimum Window Substring)
tasks.description: Sliding window advanced

tasks.title: Write STAR Stories 2 & 3
tasks.description: Technical Excellence + Impact & Results
tasks.notes: Practice delivering aloud, natural pacing

tasks.title: Submit First 3 Job Applications
tasks.description: Customize resume + apply to 3 companies
tasks.notes: Pick 3 'warm-up' companies you'd be happy with

days.title: Linked Lists + STAR Refinement
days.description: Introduce linked lists + polish stories

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #206 (Reverse Linked List)
tasks.description: Pointer manipulation

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #21 (Merge Two Sorted Lists)
tasks.description: List merging

tasks.title: Record STAR Stories
tasks.description: Record yourself telling each story (video or audio)
tasks.notes: Play back and note: pacing, clarity, enthusiasm

tasks.title: Submit 3 More Applications + Network
tasks.description: Continue applications and build network
tasks.notes: Send 5 personalized connection requests to hiring managers

days.title: Week 1 Review + Job Applications
days.description: Review learnings + application push

tasks.title: Redo 5 Hardest Problems from Scratch
tasks.description: No looking at solutions, time yourself
tasks.notes: Aim for <5 min each for easy, <15 min for medium

tasks.title: Polish Resume & LinkedIn
tasks.description: Get feedback, implement, finalize
tasks.notes: Share with 2-3 friends for feedback

tasks.title: Application Push
tasks.description: Submit 5 applications
tasks.notes: Update target company list with top 20 priorities

weeks.title: Week 2: Trees, Graphs & System Design Intro
weeks.description: Tree/graph fundamentals + Introduce system design thinking
goals: Master tree and graph algorithms (28+ problems)
Understand system design fundamentals (scalability, load balancing, caching)
Develop understanding of 3 major system designs

days.title: Trees Fundamentals + System Design Intro
days.description: DFS, BFS, recursion patterns + scalability basics

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #104 (Maximum Depth of Tree)
tasks.description: DFS recursion

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #102 (Binary Tree Level Order Traversal)
tasks.description: BFS with queue

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #98 (Validate Binary Search Tree)
tasks.description: Tree property validation

tasks.title: Study System Design Basics
tasks.description: Scalability, horizontal vs vertical, load balancing

days.title: Graphs + Database Design
days.description: Graph algorithms + SQL vs NoSQL

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #200 (Number of Islands)
tasks.description: DFS on grid

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #207 (Course Schedule)
tasks.description: Topological sort, cycle detection

tasks.title: Study Database Design
tasks.description: SQL vs NoSQL, ACID, CAP theorem

days.title: Dynamic Programming Intro + Design Twitter
days.description: Simple DP + first system design case study

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #70 (Climbing Stairs)
tasks.description: Simple DP/Fibonacci

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #198 (House Robber)
tasks.description: 1D DP with state tracking

tasks.title: Learn Design Twitter
tasks.description: Features, data model, architecture, scalability
tasks.notes: Watch 30-45 min detailed explanation

days.title: More Graphs + Design Uber
days.description: Advanced graph algorithms + second system design

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #15 (3Sum)
tasks.description: Sorting + two pointers

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #133 (Clone Graph)
tasks.description: DFS/BFS with visited set

tasks.title: Learn Design Uber
tasks.description: Real-time matching, location tracking, payments

days.title: Recursion & Backtracking + STAR Refinement
days.description: Backtracking patterns + interview prep

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #46 (Permutations)
tasks.description: Backtracking

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #39 (Combination Sum)
tasks.description: Backtracking with reuse

tasks.title: Refine STAR Stories
tasks.description: Add details, practice in front of mirror
tasks.notes: Confident tone, natural pacing, no filler words

days.title: Heaps & Advanced Algorithms + Design Instagram
days.description: Heap problems + third system design

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #215 (Kth Largest Element)
tasks.description: Min-heap

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #347 (Top K Frequent)
tasks.description: Heap with frequency

tasks.title: Learn Design Instagram
tasks.description: Feed, posts, likes, comments, real-time notifications

days.title: Week 2 Review + Application Blitz
days.description: Problem review + application push

tasks.title: Redo 7 Hardest Problems
tasks.description: From scratch, faster than Day 1
tasks.notes: Identify patterns across problems

tasks.title: Review System Designs
tasks.description: Watch 1 more design case study
tasks.notes: Sketch solution before watching

tasks.title: Application Blitz
tasks.description: Submit 5 applications + research + follow-up
tasks.notes: Research company tech stack and recent engineering blogs

weeks.title: Week 3: DP, Greedy & System Design Deep Dive
weeks.description: Advanced algorithms + Master 2-3 system designs deeply + Start getting interviews
goals: Master complex DP and greedy algorithms (~25 coding problems)
Deep dive on 3 system designs (Dropbox, Netflix, WhatsApp)

days.title: Advanced DP + System Design: Design Dropbox
days.description: 2D DP problems + file storage system design

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #72 (Edit Distance)
tasks.description: 2D DP — classic string transformation problem
tasks.keyTakeaway: 2D DP on two strings, insert/delete/replace operations

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #516 (Longest Palindromic Subsequence)
tasks.description: DP on subsequences

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #97 (Interleaving String)
tasks.description: 2D DP — interleaving two strings

tasks.title: System Design: Design Dropbox
tasks.description: File upload, sync, sharing, versioning, CDN, database sharding
tasks.notes: Focus on: file chunking, deduplication, sync conflicts, metadata DB vs blob storage

days.title: Greedy Algorithms + System Design: Design Netflix
days.description: Greedy optimization patterns + video streaming design

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #435 (Non-overlapping Intervals)
tasks.description: Greedy interval scheduling
tasks.keyTakeaway: Sort by end time, greedy pick

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #45 (Jump Game II)
tasks.description: Greedy with sliding window approach

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #56 (Merge Intervals)
tasks.description: Greedy interval merging

tasks.title: System Design: Design Netflix
tasks.description: Video streaming, transcoding, CDN, recommendations, bitrate adaptation
tasks.notes: Focus on: video pipeline, adaptive streaming, content delivery network, recommendation engine

days.title: String DP + Full Mock Interview #1
days.description: String DP problems + first timed mock interview

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #131 (Palindrome Partitioning)
tasks.description: Backtracking + palindrome check

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #139 (Word Break)
tasks.description: DP with dictionary set
tasks.keyTakeaway: DP boolean array, check all prefixes

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #212 (Word Search II)
tasks.description: Trie + DFS on grid
tasks.keyTakeaway: Build trie from words, DFS grid with trie pruning

tasks.title: Full Mock Interview #1
tasks.description: 45 min coding (LeetCode Hard timed) + 15 min behavioral questions. Record yourself.
tasks.notes: Explain thinking aloud, test with examples, practice STAR delivery

days.title: Sliding Window + System Design: Design WhatsApp
days.description: Sliding window problems + real-time messaging design

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #438 (Find All Anagrams in a String)
tasks.description: Fixed-size sliding window with frequency map

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #567 (Permutation in String)
tasks.description: Sliding window on permutation

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #819 (Most Common Word)
tasks.description: String parsing + hash map frequency

tasks.title: System Design: Design WhatsApp
tasks.description: Real-time messaging, group chats, message delivery guarantees, WebSockets
tasks.notes: Focus on: message ordering, delivery receipts, end-to-end encryption, presence system

days.title: Coding Sprint + Behavioral Deep Dive
days.description: Speed drill on 10 mixed problems + STAR story refinement

tasks.title: Coding Sprint: 10 Mixed Problems
tasks.description: Solve 10 random easy/medium LeetCode problems as fast as possible. Build speed and pattern recognition.
tasks.notes: Don't over-optimize, just get working solutions. Build speed.

tasks.title: Behavioral Deep Dive
tasks.description: Practice all 5 STAR stories with a friend. Refine answers to: Why Google? Where do you see yourself in 5 years? Weaknesses?
tasks.notes: Get feedback: Are stories compelling? Too long? Memorable?

tasks.title: Submit 5 Applications + Schedule Interviews
tasks.description: Submit applications, check for interview invites, schedule them
tasks.notes: Mark calendar 1 week before each interview for prep sprint

days.title: Full Mock Interview #2 + System Design Practice
days.description: Second mock interview + collaborative system design

tasks.title: Full Mock Interview #2
tasks.description: 60 min: Two LeetCode mediums back-to-back (30 min each). Focus on clean code, good variable names, edge cases.
tasks.notes: Explain thinking, test thoroughly, write production-quality code

tasks.title: System Design Practice: Design Pinterest or Airbnb
tasks.description: Sketch data model, API design, scalability challenges, trade-offs for a complex system
tasks.notes: Focus on: feed generation, search, recommendations, media storage

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications + Networking
tasks.description: Submit apps, send 10 personalized connection requests mentioning specific things about their work

days.title: Week 3 Review + Interview Prep Intensive
days.description: Review weak areas + prepare for upcoming interviews

tasks.title: Solve 8 Problems from Weak Areas
tasks.description: Identify 3-4 problem types you still struggle with. Deep dive on 1 of them.
tasks.notes: Watch videos, understand patterns for your weakest topic

tasks.title: Prepare for Upcoming Interviews
tasks.description: Research each company deeply. Prepare 3-4 smart questions, 2-minute pitch, 2-3 projects to discuss.
tasks.notes: Know: their product, recent news, tech blog posts

tasks.title: Application Push + Tracker Update
tasks.description: Submit 5 applications. Update tracker: applications sent, interviews scheduled, follow-ups needed.
tasks.notes: You should have 5+ interviews scheduled by now!

weeks.title: Week 4: Interview Week 1 — Coding & System Design
weeks.description: Crush your first interviews, maintain momentum with applications

days.title: Interview Mindset + Coding Drills
days.description: Mental prep + solve 5 medium problems at interview pace

tasks.title: Solve 5 Medium Problems at Interview Pace
tasks.description: Time yourself: 20-25 min per problem. Practice articulating your solution clearly.
tasks.notes: Don't cheat! Simulate real interview conditions.

tasks.title: Research 3 Companies with Interviews Scheduled
tasks.description: For each company: answer 'Why this company?', know their tech stack and recent news

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications
tasks.description: Continue applying to maintain pipeline

days.title: Interview Day (or Practice Day)
days.description: If interview: warm up + crush it. If no interview: hard practice session.

tasks.title: Pre-Interview Warm-up: 5 Easy Problems
tasks.description: Light warm-up to get brain engaged. Don't tire yourself before interview.
tasks.notes: If no interview today, switch to 4 medium/hard problems instead

tasks.title: Company Deep Dive + Mental Focus
tasks.description: Review company tech stack, 2-3 data structures you might need, breathing exercises
tasks.notes: 30 min before interview: positive mindset, review key algorithms

tasks.title: Post-Interview Debrief + Applications
tasks.description: After interview: debrief (what went well? what to improve?). Apply to 3 more companies.
tasks.notes: Don't overthink the interview after it's done

days.title: Coding Practice + Interview Prep
days.description: Stay sharp with medium/hard problems + prepare for next interview

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #152 (Maximum Product Subarray)
tasks.description: DP tracking min and max

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #300 (Longest Increasing Subsequence)
tasks.description: DP with binary search optimization
tasks.keyTakeaway: Patience sorting with binary search for O(n log n)

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #42 (Trapping Rain Water)
tasks.description: Two pointers or stack approach

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications + Networking
tasks.description: Apply to companies and send connection requests to people at target companies

days.title: Interview Day (or Practice Day)
days.description: Interview or practice session + applications

tasks.title: Pre-Interview Warm-up or Practice Problems
tasks.description: If interview: 5 easy warm-ups. If not: 4 medium problems from weak areas.
tasks.notes: Focus on patterns you've seen in past interviews

tasks.title: System Design Quick Review
tasks.description: Review 1 system design if you have a design interview coming up
tasks.notes: Sketch solution from memory before reviewing notes

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications + Follow-ups
tasks.description: Apply + follow up with recruiters who haven't responded

days.title: Mixed Practice + Behavioral Refresh
days.description: Variety of problems + polish behavioral answers

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #23 (Merge K Sorted Lists)
tasks.description: Min-heap with linked lists

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #33 (Search in Rotated Sorted Array)
tasks.description: Modified binary search

tasks.title: Behavioral Story Refresh
tasks.description: Practice 3 STAR stories aloud. Practice 'Tell me about yourself' (2 min max).
tasks.notes: Confident tone, no filler words, natural pacing

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications
tasks.description: Continue application pipeline

days.title: Interview Day (or Hard Problem Session)
days.description: Interview or tackle hard problems + applications

tasks.title: Hard Problem Practice Session
tasks.description: Solve 3 hard problems (or warm up for interview). Focus on clear communication.
tasks.notes: If interview today: use first 45 min for easy warm-ups instead

tasks.title: Post-Interview Debrief or System Design Review
tasks.description: Debrief interview performance or review a system design case study

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications + Network
tasks.description: Applications + reach out to 5 people at companies where you interviewed

days.title: Week 4 Review + Rest
days.description: Light review, collect feedback, plan next week

tasks.title: Review All Interview Feedback
tasks.description: What patterns emerge across interviews? Which topics need more work?
tasks.notes: Categorize: coding strengths/gaps, communication, system design, behavioral

tasks.title: Light Practice: 5 Problems for Fun
tasks.description: Don't stress — just enjoy solving. Pick interesting problems.

tasks.title: Submit 5 Applications + Weekly Reflection
tasks.description: Application push + update tracker. Reflect: What went well? What to change?
tasks.notes: You should have 3-7 interviews completed by now!

weeks.title: Week 5: Interview Week 2 — System Design & Behavioral
weeks.description: Ace system design and behavioral interviews + continue applications
goals: Ace system design interviews with detailed architecture
Deliver flawless STAR stories in behavioral rounds

days.title: System Design Interview Prep
days.description: Review and practice system design case studies

tasks.title: Review System Design: Design URL Shortener
tasks.description: Study case: hashing, database design, analytics, rate limiting
tasks.notes: Sketch your solution first before watching

tasks.title: Practice System Design Solo: Design a Notification System
tasks.description: 45 min timed: sketch architecture, discuss trade-offs, scale considerations
tasks.notes: Focus on: push vs pull, message queues, delivery guarantees, multi-channel (email, SMS, push)

tasks.title: Solve 3 Coding Problems (Stay Sharp)
tasks.description: Mix of medium problems to keep coding skills fresh
tasks.notes: Pick from weak areas identified in Week 4 interviews

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications + Networking
tasks.description: Continue pipeline + reach out to engineers at companies with upcoming interviews

days.title: System Design Interview Day
days.description: Design interview prep or practice + applications

tasks.title: Pre-Interview: Review Company Tech Stack
tasks.description: Know their product, scale, tech blog posts. Be ready to discuss trade-offs.
tasks.notes: If no interview: practice designing their product as a system

tasks.title: System Design Practice: Design a Chat System
tasks.description: Real-time messaging at scale: WebSockets, message ordering, presence
tasks.notes: Compare to WhatsApp design — what's different for enterprise chat?

tasks.title: Solve 2 Medium Coding Problems
tasks.description: Quick practice to stay sharp between interviews

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications
tasks.description: Continue applying + follow up on pending responses

days.title: System Design + Coding Mixed Day
days.description: Balanced practice across all interview types

tasks.title: System Design Review: Design YouTube
tasks.description: Video upload pipeline, transcoding, CDN, recommendations, search

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #146 (LRU Cache)
tasks.description: Hash map + doubly linked list

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #297 (Serialize and Deserialize Binary Tree)
tasks.description: Tree serialization with BFS/DFS

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications + Send Thank-You Notes
tasks.description: Apply + send personalized thank-you emails to recent interviewers
tasks.notes: Thank-you notes should reference specific discussion points

days.title: Behavioral Interview Day
days.description: Practice and deliver STAR stories + prepare for behavioral rounds

tasks.title: Practice All STAR Stories (2 min each)
tasks.description: Deliver each of your 5 best stories. Time yourself. Natural, confident, authentic.
tasks.notes: Practice: Why us? Weaknesses? Tell me about a failure.

tasks.title: Prepare Answers: Why This Company? (for 3 companies)
tasks.description: Research mission, products, culture. Write personalized answers.

tasks.title: Solve 2 Coding Problems (Light Practice)
tasks.description: Keep coding muscles warm with medium problems

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications
tasks.description: Continue pipeline — don't slow down on applications

days.title: Behavioral Mastery + Interview Follow-up
days.description: Polish behavioral delivery + track interview progress

tasks.title: Mock Behavioral Interview (30 min)
tasks.description: Have a friend ask you random behavioral questions. Record and review.
tasks.notes: Show genuine interest, ask thoughtful questions, tell authentic stories with passion

tasks.title: Solve 3 Coding Problems
tasks.description: Mix of graph, DP, and array problems

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications + Follow-up Emails
tasks.description: Apply + follow up with companies where you're waiting on feedback
tasks.notes: Professional follow-up: 'I'm very excited about the opportunity...'

days.title: Interview Assessment + Improvement
days.description: Review all interview feedback, identify patterns, improve

tasks.title: Review All Interview Feedback
tasks.description: What went well across all interviews? Where do you need improvement?
tasks.notes: Create improvement plan for any recurring weaknesses

tasks.title: Targeted Practice on Weak Areas
tasks.description: Spend focused time on problem types or concepts that came up in interviews where you struggled

tasks.title: Submit 5 Applications + Safety Net
tasks.description: Apply to more companies as a safety net. Include stretch companies.

days.title: Week 5 Review + On-Site Prep
days.description: Assess progress + prepare for on-site rounds

tasks.title: Week 5 Assessment
tasks.description: By now: 10+ interviews completed, 3-5 phone screens passed, 2-3 on-sites scheduled
tasks.notes: If fewer interviews: ramp up applications. If many: focus on on-site prep.

tasks.title: Light Practice: 5 Problems Just for Fun
tasks.description: Enjoy problem-solving without pressure. Pick interesting problems.

tasks.title: Prepare for On-Sites
tasks.description: Research each on-site company deeply. Plan outfit, logistics, questions for each interviewer.
tasks.notes: On-sites are the final stretch — prepare to give your best performance!

weeks.title: Week 6: On-Site Preparation & Advanced Topics
weeks.description: Prepare for final on-site rounds + advanced coding topics
goals: Master advanced topics: Tries, Union-Find, Intervals (~20 problems)

days.title: Advanced Data Structures + On-Site Prep
days.description: Trie and Union-Find problems + company deep dive

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #208 (Implement Trie)
tasks.description: Trie data structure implementation
tasks.keyTakeaway: HashMap of children nodes, isEnd flag

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #211 (Design Add and Search Words)
tasks.description: Trie with wildcard DFS

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #128 (Longest Consecutive Sequence)
tasks.description: Union-Find or HashSet approach
tasks.keyTakeaway: HashSet — only start counting from sequence beginnings

tasks.title: On-Site Company Research
tasks.description: Deep dive on company with upcoming on-site: team structure, projects, interview panel
tasks.notes: Prepare specific questions for each interviewer

days.title: Interval Problems + Interview Practice
days.description: Interval-based problems + timed practice

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #57 (Insert Interval)
tasks.description: Interval insertion and merging

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #253 (Meeting Rooms II)
tasks.description: Min-heap for overlapping intervals
tasks.keyTakeaway: Sort by start, use min-heap for end times

tasks.title: Timed Mock: 2 Problems in 45 Minutes
tasks.description: Simulate real interview: 2 medium problems, explain thinking, test edge cases
tasks.notes: Focus on: speed, communication, code quality

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications
tasks.description: Continue applications for safety net

days.title: Mixed Hard Problems + On-Site Prep
days.description: Challenge yourself with hard problems + final on-site preparation

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #124 (Binary Tree Maximum Path Sum)
tasks.description: DFS with global max tracking
tasks.keyTakeaway: At each node: max(left, right, both). Track global max separately.

tasks.title: Solve LeetCode #295 (Find Median from Data Stream)
tasks.description: Two heaps (max-heap + min-heap)
tasks.keyTakeaway: Balance two heaps, median from tops

tasks.title: On-Site Final Prep
tasks.description: Prepare questions for each interviewer. Review all system designs. Practice 2-min pitch.
tasks.notes: You've prepared for this — trust yourself!

tasks.title: Submit 3 Applications
tasks.description: Keep pipeline active

days.title: Negotiation Prep + Light Practice
days.description: Learn salary negotiation + stay sharp

tasks.title: Salary Negotiation Strategy
tasks.description: Research salary ranges (Levels.fyi, Blind). Determine minimum acceptable and target salary.
tasks.notes: Know: base salary, signing bonus, stock options/RSUs, benefits, PTO

tasks.title: Solve 3 Medium Problems (Stay Sharp)
tasks.description: Quick practice to maintain skills

tasks.title: Prepare Negotiation Talking Points
tasks.description: Write down your value proposition, competing offers, market rate data
tasks.notes: Never accept the first offer — always negotiate professionally

days.title: On-Site Day
days.description: Final warm-up + crush the on-site interview

tasks.title: Final 5-Problem Warm-up
tasks.description: Quick easy problems to get brain engaged. Don't tire yourself.
tasks.notes: Solve familiar patterns, build confidence

tasks.title: On-Site Interview
tasks.description: You've prepared for this. Trust yourself. Be confident, clear, and authentic.
tasks.notes: Ask good questions, be genuinely curious about their team and problems

tasks.title: Post-Interview Debrief
tasks.description: Immediately after: write down every question asked, how you answered, what went well/poorly
tasks.notes: Send thank-you notes within 24 hours

days.title: Post On-Site + Continue Applications
days.description: Recover from on-site + keep pipeline active

tasks.title: Send Thank-You Notes to All Interviewers
tasks.description: Personalized emails referencing specific discussion points from the on-site
tasks.notes: Professional, enthusiastic, reference specific conversations

tasks.title: Continue Applications (5 Companies)
tasks.description: Don't stop applying until you have accepted an offer

tasks.title: Follow Up on Pending Interviews
tasks.description: Check status of all outstanding applications and interviews. Ask: 'When should I expect feedback?'
tasks.notes: If offers come: DO NOT accept immediately

days.title: Week 6 Review + Offer Comparison
days.description: Review progress + begin comparing any offers received

tasks.title: Offer Comparison Matrix
tasks.description: If offers received: compare base salary, RSU, signing bonus, benefits, growth, location, team, culture
tasks.notes: Create spreadsheet with weighted scores for each factor

tasks.title: Light Practice: 3 Problems
tasks.description: Stay sharp in case more interviews come up

tasks.title: Weekly Reflection + Plan Week 7
tasks.description: What worked? What didn't? Plan next week's interview/negotiation strategy.
tasks.notes: You should have on-sites completed and possibly offers in hand!

weeks.title: Week 7: Offer Negotiations & Final Decision
weeks.description: Negotiate best offers, make final decision, prepare for transition
goals: Light coding to stay sharp (~10 problems)

days.title: Negotiation Strategy + First Calls
days.description: Begin negotiations with companies that have extended offers

tasks.title: Review All Offers in Detail
tasks.description: For each offer: total comp (base + bonus + RSU), benefits, PTO, remote policy, growth
tasks.notes: Don't just compare base salary — look at total compensation over 4 years

tasks.title: Prepare Negotiation Scripts
tasks.description: For each company: write talking points highlighting your value and competing offers
tasks.notes: Be professional, enthusiastic, and firm. Show you've done your research.

tasks.title: Light Coding Practice: 2 Problems
tasks.description: Stay warm in case any final interviews come up

days.title: Active Negotiations
days.description: Make negotiation calls/emails + continue any remaining interviews

tasks.title: Negotiate with Company #1
tasks.description: Call or email with specific ask. Highlight competing offers, market data, your unique value.
tasks.notes: Target: +10-20% above initial offer if possible

tasks.title: Negotiate with Company #2
tasks.description: Same approach: professional, data-driven, confident

tasks.title: Get Everything in Writing
tasks.description: Request updated offer letters with negotiated terms. Review all details carefully.
tasks.notes: Check: start date, equity vesting schedule, signing bonus timing, relocation

days.title: Continue Negotiations + Decision Framework
days.description: Follow up on negotiations + build decision matrix

tasks.title: Follow Up on Pending Negotiations
tasks.description: Check status of all negotiations. Push for final numbers.

tasks.title: Build Decision Matrix
tasks.description: Create weighted scoring: compensation (30%), growth (25%), culture (20%), location (15%), work-life (10%)
tasks.notes: Adjust weights based on your personal priorities

tasks.title: Light Coding Practice: 2 Problems
tasks.description: Keep skills warm just in case

days.title: Final Decision Day
days.description: Make your final decision with confidence

tasks.title: Talk to Mentors/Friends About Offers
tasks.description: Get outside perspective on your top choices. Discuss career trajectory.
tasks.notes: Ask: 'If you were me, which would you choose and why?'

tasks.title: Make Final Decision
tasks.description: Review decision matrix, trust your gut, and commit to your top choice.
tasks.notes: Once decided, don't second-guess. You made a great choice!

tasks.title: Accept Offer + Decline Others
tasks.description: Accept your top choice in writing. Professionally decline other offers with gratitude.
tasks.notes: Declining professionally keeps doors open for the future

days.title: Transition Planning
days.description: Plan your job transition

tasks.title: Give Notice at Current Job (if employed)
tasks.description: Professional 2-week notice. Prepare transition document for your team.
tasks.notes: Be gracious, offer to help with transition, maintain relationships

tasks.title: Review Offer Letter Details
tasks.description: Confirm: start date, salary, equity, benefits enrollment, onboarding steps

tasks.title: Light Coding: 2 Fun Problems
tasks.description: Just for enjoyment — you've earned it!

days.title: New Company Prep
days.description: Start preparing for day 1 at your new company

tasks.title: Research New Company Codebase
tasks.description: If public: explore GitHub repos. Read engineering blog posts. Watch tech talks.
tasks.notes: Understand: tech stack, architecture patterns, coding standards

tasks.title: Prepare Questions for Your Manager
tasks.description: List thoughtful questions about: team goals, expectations, onboarding, first projects

days.title: Celebrate + Rest
days.description: You did it! Take time to celebrate this achievement.

tasks.title: Update LinkedIn with New Role
tasks.description: Announce your new position. Thank people who helped along the way.
tasks.notes: A gracious announcement post can strengthen your professional network

tasks.title: Celebrate and Rest!
tasks.description: You've worked incredibly hard. Celebrate with family and friends. Take time to recharge.
tasks.notes: JOB OFFER ACCEPTED! You earned this!

weeks.title: Week 8: Preparation & Soft Landing
weeks.description: Prepare to succeed at your new company — first impressions matter
goals: Deep dive on new company tech stack and culture
Arrive at day 1 confident and prepared

days.title: Company Deep Dive — Codebase & Architecture
days.description: Understand your new company's technical landscape

tasks.title: Read Company Engineering Blog (5-10 Articles)
tasks.description: Understand their technical challenges, architecture decisions, and values
tasks.notes: Note: what tech stack do they use? What patterns? What problems are they solving?

tasks.title: Watch Company Engineering Talks
tasks.description: Find YouTube talks from engineers at the company. Understand their approach to problems.

tasks.title: Light Coding Review: 2 Easy Problems
tasks.description: Keep brain sharp for any initial coding during onboarding

days.title: Company Deep Dive — Products & Culture
days.description: Understand the product, users, and company culture

tasks.title: Use the Company's Product Deeply
tasks.description: Sign up, explore every feature, think about the engineering behind it
tasks.notes: Think like a user AND an engineer. Note bugs, improvements, questions.

tasks.title: Read Company Values & Culture Docs
tasks.description: Understand mission, values, how they work, what they care about

tasks.title: Light Coding Review: 2 Medium Problems
tasks.description: Review key patterns: hash maps, two pointers, BFS/DFS

days.title: Development Environment Setup
days.description: Set up tools and environment for your new role

tasks.title: Setup Development Environment
tasks.description: Install relevant languages, frameworks, tools. Configure IDE. Set up dotfiles.
tasks.notes: If the company uses specific tools (e.g., IntelliJ, VS Code), make sure you're comfortable

tasks.title: Review Any Pre-Onboarding Materials
tasks.description: If the company sent onboarding docs, videos, or reading material — complete them

tasks.title: Light Coding: 2 Problems from Company's Domain
tasks.description: If the company focuses on specific areas (e.g., distributed systems), practice related problems

days.title: Confidence Building — Light Review
days.description: Review your strengths and build confidence for day 1

tasks.title: Review Your Best Solutions
tasks.description: Look at your top 10 LeetCode solutions. Remind yourself how far you've come.
tasks.notes: You solved 180+ problems! You're more than ready.

tasks.title: Prepare First-Week Questions
tasks.description: List smart questions to ask during onboarding: architecture, team workflows, code review process
tasks.notes: Asking good questions shows initiative and curiosity

tasks.title: Light Coding: 2 Easy-Medium Problems
tasks.description: Stay sharp, keep confidence high

days.title: Final Technical Prep
days.description: Last round of preparation before starting

tasks.title: Review System Design Notes
tasks.description: Quick review of your system design notes. You may need these in early team discussions.

tasks.title: Practice Self-Introduction for New Team
tasks.description: Prepare a 1-2 minute introduction: background, what excites you about the role, what you bring
tasks.notes: Natural, enthusiastic, authentic — not a resume recitation

tasks.title: Setup Home Office
tasks.description: Organize workspace, test equipment, prepare for first day logistics

days.title: Final Prep + Visualization
days.description: Last day of structured prep

tasks.title: Read Company Handbook
tasks.description: If provided: review policies, benefits enrollment, HR processes

tasks.title: Visualize Your First Day
tasks.description: Imagine: meeting your team, setting up your laptop, your first standup. You belong here.
tasks.notes: Positive visualization builds confidence

tasks.title: Confirm Start Date Logistics
tasks.description: Confirm: time, location/remote link, what to bring, who to contact on day 1

days.title: Rest & Celebration
days.description: NO coding today. You've earned this.

tasks.title: Rest Your Brain
tasks.description: No coding, no studying. Watch a movie, go for a walk, spend time with family.
tasks.notes: You completed an 8-week intensive job search. That takes incredible discipline.

tasks.title: Celebrate the Achievement!
tasks.description: You went from preparation to offer in 8 weeks. Celebrate with the people who supported you.
tasks.notes: Confidence at all-time high. Ready for day 1. You've got this!
